attributes.action: Unfare Taxation on cars over 225Co2 emissions & older Cars
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
New car tax rates for 2009  
Alistair Darling has unveiled changes to vehicle excise duty - reclassifying vehicles according to the levels of carbon dioxide they emit. 

While it should be good news for those with environmentally-friendly cars, it will hike the amount paid by owners of high-polluting vehicles who also face a "showroom tax" payable in the first year after they buy a new gas-guzzler. It will also hit poorer families with older cars who cannot afford to upgrade to a newer car with less emissions. 

Some families may find themselves paying £400 a year.

Vehicle tax should go on usage of vehicle & not on Co2.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
